Exciting Opportunity for a Data Analyst

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll collaborate with database developers, data analysts, data engineers, and software engineers to create simpler, faster, and more insightful solutions for supply chain performance managers, decision-makers, specialists, and frontline personnel.

Data Analyst’s Key Responsibilities:

Gain a thorough understanding of business use cases, technologies, and best practices for key reports, tools, dashboards, ETL processes, and applications we support.
Act as the primary point of contact for technical support and enhancement requests.
Enhance the reliability of key reports, tools, dashboards, ETL processes, and applications.
Monitor and ensure the quality control of scheduled weekly technical tasks.

Your Impact:

As a Data Analyst, you will:

Improve the reliability of key reports, tools, dashboards, ETL processes, and applications.
Propose preferred methods for receiving technical support and enhancement requests from business teams and users.
Prioritize and utilize available support options (your expertise, experts, diagnostic tools, documentation, how-to videos, etc.) to address issues and enhancement requests effectively.
Handle technical support and enhancement requests from internal business teams or users, clarify as needed, research root causes, develop plans, complete requests, and communicate statuses back to requestors.
Monitor data updates and availability (e.g., user permissions) for published Tableau and PowerBI dashboards.
Complete weekly scheduled technical tasks on time, resolve discrepancies, and communicate with business teams as necessary.
Keep solution documentation up to date (common issues, how-to instructions, and enhancement details).
Inform team members about the stability of specific reports, tools, dashboards, ETL processes, or applications, identify sources of instability, suggest improvements, and track the progress of action plans to enhance performance.

Why Join Us?

Be part of a team where your contributions make a difference. Work in a supportive environment that values innovation and continuous improvement. This role is perfect for individuals who are passionate about data, enjoy problem-solving, and are eager to drive impactful changes.

Qualifications

Who Are We Looking For?

Education

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in business systems or information technology

Experience

Fluent in English
Experience in programming (VBA, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
Intermediate SQL skills (e.g., Joins, Group By, Select, Update, Delete)
Experience creating or executing ETL processes
Experience with Tableau and/or PowerBI

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be in charge to generate processes and models to solve information needs of different business cells (Chanel & Premium Brands) generate, update, and manage semi-automated data visualization dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Excel, for use by different business areas. You will work closely with all functions (Key Account, Retail, Point of Sale Marketing, Training, Press, Logistics)

You will also be a key contact for our distributors, with whom you will be in regular contact.

You will also act as a facilitator between the IT and Business teams.

You will report to the Beauty Fragrances sales team.

Key Responsibilities

Business Analyst


Providing the various company departments and top management with analyses and recommendations to feed into business decisions.
You will produce “ad hoc” analyses to identify business risks/opportunities or to respond to specific issues.
Redesigning all the dashboards used to monitor Sell In and Sell Out figures for the local market using Power BI
Reporting/analyzing results, performance, and communication with the sales team, summarizing key information and making proposals on the strategy to be adopted.
Preparing customer meetings (sales & targets).


Category Management


Working with the Marketing team on building forecasts and analyses to monitor our campaigns and performance.
Working with the Marketing and Sales teams to adapt our range to our customers' needs.


Data collection


Establishes connections with customer systems to collect sales and inventory data in an automated manner.
Captures relevant data on activations, campaigns, and any other relevant information to generate insights.


Data cleansing and transformation


Uses tools such as Microsoft Power Query to cleanse and transform data, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Integrates data from different sources to obtain a holistic view.


Reporting and Visualization Dashboards


Uses Microsoft Power BI and Excel to create semi-automated visualization dashboards that reflect key KPIs and insights relevant to each business area.
Design intuitive and customized dashboards for each user or department, allowing easy access to relevant information.
Analyzing needs and setting up dashboards, in line with our new organization
Power BI development (Power BI Service, Power BI Desktop, DAX, Power Query) in compliance with the Group's IT rules.


Analysis and Insights Generation


Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Generate actionable insights that can streamline stakeholder decision making and improve business performance.


Quota Setting and Forecasting


Uses historical sales data, activations, and market trends to establish accurate monthly sales targets and forecasts.
Defines quotas and forecasts nationally and by SKU for each client, also considering future launches and campaigns.


Support to the Commercial Department


Provides continuous support to the commercial area cells, offering analysis and recommendations to optimize their performance.


Generation of the Monthly Close


Prepares and communicates the monthly sales report, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the information collected from all customers.
Presents results in a clear and concise manner, highlighting key indicators and trends.


Qualitative and Strategic Analysis


Performs a qualitative analysis of the information generated to guide the commercial strategy, identifying areas of opportunity and possible improvements.


What are we looking for?


Strong project management skills with excellent attention to detail.
Ability to manage and oversee multiple projects concurrently.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, excel & power BI.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Must be an organized team player with solid interpersonal skills.
Self-motivated, team player, strong at collaborative working relationships.
Position requires a minimum 2-year relevant work experience as a business data analyst, supply chain analyst.
Experience working on multiple projects at the same time.
Fluency in English & Spanish is a must have, French is a plus.
